chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)
Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek Lee Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-  Count 2 of 22CF93 readin and dismissed.

-  Defendant to report to Probation by 9:00 am on 8/17/2022. 

-  In the event of revocation of probation, the defendant will be given 4 days credit from the ultimate sentence.

miscConds.notes: $243.00 court costs and $200.00 DNA surcharge payable through probation.

-  Complete any/all programming as deemed by COMPAS and DOC.

3:38 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derek Lee Nelson in court.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Derek Lee Nelson. There is an agreement to an amended charge. Court amends to misdemeanor 948.21 - child neglect. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to amended Ct 1 in 22CF93. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 22CF93 - amended. On motion of the State without objection, Crt READS in and dismisses Ct 2 in 22CF93. Sentence recommendations. 
Court Orders: S/W 1 year probation with conditions: 
- Court Costs: $243. payable through probation.   
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200.00 - payable through probation
- Complete any/all programming as deemed by COMPAS and Dept. of Corrections. 
4 days credit in the event of revocation. 
Report to probation before 9 am on 8/17/22.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, LMON.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Holly Elkin Rockow   DF ATTY:  Travis Satorius   DF:  Derek Lee Nelson appeared. Case called at 3:04 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a preliminary hearing. ADA Rockow calls Officer Mann to the Stand. S/T Thomas Mann, Jr. Employed with the Village of Roberts Police Department. Direct by ADA Rockow. Witness identifies DE in the courtroom. Record reflects identification. Cross by Atty Satorius. Witness excused. No further evidence by either party. No argument. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. ADA Rockow requesting to schedule arraignment. Address confirmed. Bond continues. Court adjourned at 3:27 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

Preliminary hearing on March 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, L.O.N.   The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
